organization.alternate_name: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis, Lou Gehrig's Disease
organization.description:
The ALS Association Florida Chapter was co-founded by patient Ann Smith in-áAugust of 1987-áas the Tampa Bay Chapter to serve the needs of those living with Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (also known as Lou Gehrig's disease) and their caregivers.-áIn 2001, the-áTampa Bay Chapter-áexpanded its services to all areas in the state of Florida and became known as the Florida Chapter. 

The ALS Association is the only national not-for-profit health organization dedicated solely to-áthe fight against ALS. The ALS Association covers all the bases: to help people living with Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis and to leave no stone unturned in search for the cure. Works together to accomplish our mission to find a cure for ALS while empowering the lives of those living with ALS through Care, Advocacy, Research, Education and Support.-áPrograms include support groups, case management, respite care, medical equipment loan, educational services, and national and state advocacy.
